text: On tap @ Purple Pig. Hazy medium orange. Aroma of floral honey and plums. Spicy plums, light honey, violets, dry finish. By far the most elegant Biere de Garde Ive ever had.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Can. Golden pour with light head. Apple, spice, yeast aromas. Flavors are mild, off fruit, spice and yeast.
Can - pours gold white head - nose/taste of apple, melon, lemon, light brett - medium body.
Dark orange pour from 12oz can at Emporium. White fluffy head. Spices, ripe fruits and mild sourness. Delicious.

Can from a mix 6 at Binnys. Amber with two finger head. Lightly tart and fruity with some funky Brett. Excellent flavor. Light Hoppy kick in the finish. I had minimal expectations, but this was pretty awesome.

Taste: refreshing, crisp, fruit notes. semi sweet fermented fruit and bread nose.
Amber color, slight haze, tall foamy head. Medium body. Complex and a bit toothy finish. 26 IBUs
Mix a 6 BInnys Skokie. Sweetish and sour. Crisp fine bubbles. Good. Serving: Can

12oz can 10/28/16 (Binnys Downers Grove Pick Six)-42° in Tulip-Pours dark golden with a big loose white head. Aroma of funk, yeast, and hops. Taste of the same with tartness on the back end. This light bodied brew is darn tasty.

12 oz. can pours a hazy orange/brown with small soapy white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma has some floral hops, Belgian yeast, and unknown spiciness. Taste is slightly sour. Body is medium with lively carbonation. This is my first from this brewery, and hopefully the first of many.

Taster at Standard Market, Westmont.Im noting a similarity between these beers and Goose islands Belgian "sister." Understandable since Gooses Barrel Room manager is now their brewmaster. So this may be considered close to Gooses Matilda, but it has more obvious brett funk. Light color, a more tart smell, though it seems more like a sour fruit. But the taste is quite zesty. Malts stay light, and the hops keep the overall effect dry.

This is a soild saison-ish whatever. Its orange brown, cloudy w/ a big foamy head. Its a little hoppy and herbal and seems to have a nice, fruity and fairly standard Belgian yeast character even though its a fully brett fermentation. Theres a nice, soft floral note around the edges and some bright mandarin orange notes that really seem to meld well w/ the light but creamy texture. Im into it.

From a can poured in a large snifter. Pours light brown. Aroma is creamy and malty. Flavor is rich and creamy with a touch of tartness and a good yeastiness. Just what I was looking for. Hops are noticeable but not overpowering. One of the best BDGs Ive had.
355ml can. Its a light, crushable biere de garde, soem herbal spice notes and a touch of tartness.
